result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Scott Thomas Volgmann

records.addlTxt: Justice Point Pretrial Services Status Report, filed.

Defendant Scott Thomas Volgmann in court by video.  Attorney John Mathew Krejci in court for Scott Thomas Volgmann.  Prosecuting attorney Sarah Dahdouh in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for a final pre-trial. Defense requests to resolve the case through a plea and sentencing. Court vacates the 10/24/22 jury trial. Case adjourned.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 10, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Pretrial Services Supervision Report Received and Filed.

Defendant Scott Thomas Volgmann in court.  Attorney John Mathew Krejci in court for Scott Thomas Volgmann.  Prosecuting attorney Sarah Dahdouh in court for the State of Wisconsin.   Defense requests Final Pretrial and Jury Trial dates. Court orders case adjourned for final pretrial and jury trial in Branch 30.
Final pre-trial scheduled for September 15, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Jury trial scheduled for October 24, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Supervision Report received and filed.  nk

Defendant Scott Thomas Volgmann in court with attorney John Mathew Krejci.  Sarah Dahdouh appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for a Jury Trial (First Call).  Case remains in trial posture.  Parties are ready to proceed. Case passed to address remainder of the Court's calendar.   

Case recalled at 9:44. (Second Call): Same appearances. 
Parties are ready to proceed. 
Court informs the parties a lower pending case has been selected. Court vacated today's jury trial.
Defense requests a status conference as the case may resolve without a trial.
Case adjourned.  Status conference scheduled for August 31, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Pretrial Services Supervision Report, received and filed

Defendant Scott Thomas Volgmann in court with attorney John Mathew Krejci.  Erika Strebel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Scott Thomas Volgmann appeared by video means with Attorney.
Case in court for final pre-trial. Case remains in trial posture. Jury trial scheduled for 8/03/2022 at 9:00AM, IN PERSON, room 622 of the Courthouse.
STATE'S Requested Jury Instructions
STATE'S MOTION IN LIMINE
States Witness List, received and filed.
Pretrial Services Supervision Report

Defendant Scott Thomas Volgmann in court with attorney John Mathew Krejci.  Adam Joseph Best appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Scott Thomas Volgmann appeared by video means with Attorney.  
Case in court for status conference.  Case is in trial posture, defense counsel requests case be placed on the trial calendar.  Any pretrial motions to be filed by the final pretrial date. Case adjourned to Branch 30. Final Pretrial is scheduled on July 14, 2022 at 8:30am. Jury trial is scheduled for August 3, 2022 at 9:00am.
JusticePoint Supervision Report, filed.

Defendant Scott Thomas Volgmann in court with attorney John Mathew Krejci.  Samantha Raygo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Scott Thomas Volgmann appeared by video means with Attorney.  
Case in court for pretrial conference. Defense counsel has not received discovery and an offer from the state.  Defense requests status date to determine case posture. Case adjourned to Branch 30.  Status conference scheduled for May 19, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
received and filed.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with A.M.G. and T.L.E.-P.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.  Court ordered no dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Scott Thomas Volgmann in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Defendant Scott Thomas Volgmann in custody.  Grace M. Gall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Scott Thomas Volgmann appeared by video means with Attorney.  
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Richards, Branch 30.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 21, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
